Key Match Events: Lane Thomas had four RBIs and the Cleveland Guardians held on behind their bullpen to beat the Chicago White Sox 6-4 on Wednesday for a three-game series sweep.
The Guardians finished 6-3 on a three-city trip that included stops in Kansas City and at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
The White Sox cut their deficit to 5-4 in the third inning, scoring three of four runs unearned following Andrés Giménez’s throwing error.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.

The White Sox starting pitcher Davis Martin reacted after giving up a solo home run to Cleveland Guardians’ Austin Hedges during the third inning of a baseball game in Chicago, Wednesday, Sept. 11, 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt said, 'I feel incredible about it. This was a tough road trip, this late in the year to be gone through three cities and play some tough teams.'
The White Sox manager Davis Martin said, 'Everybody pissed, Every time we go score four runs for me, it’s like, hey, that’s well in the ballpark for us to get a victory. It’s my job to set the tone.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago dropped a franchise-record 15th straight at home, lost its 17th in 19 overall and was swept for the 24th time.
The Guardians moved 4 1/2 games ahead of second-place Kansas City when the Royals lost 4-3 in 11 innings at Yankee Stadium.
At 33-114, the White Sox are closing in on the post-1900 record for losses — 120 by the 1962 New York Mets in their inaugural season.
Others: RHP Ben Lively is expected to make his next scheduled start, on Sunday against Tampa Bay, after being hit on the outside of his right thigh by Dominic Fletcher’s liner in the second inning of his start on Tuesday.
RHP James Karinchak, out all season with right shoulder inflammation, has joined Triple-A Columbus on a rehab assignment and is expected to pitch in “competitive games.”
